results.title: Behind the Backlash Against Bud Light’s Transgender Influencer
results.abstract: After Dylan Mulvaney promoted the beer on Instagram, well-known conservatives tried to start a boycott. Experts say the controversy will not hurt the brand in the long run, and may help.

results.byline: By Anton Troianovski, Andrew E. Kramer, Erika Solomon and Eric Schmitt
results.title: Pentagon Leaks: New Twists in a Familiar Plot
results.abstract: Some in Ukraine even welcomed the disclosures as confirming what they have been saying for months — that its forces desperately need more weapons and munitions.

media.caption: A Ukrainian artillery team unloading artillery shells. The leaked Pentagon documents warned of looming shortages of the munitions, but Ukrainian officials have been saying that publicly for months.

results.title: For Former Friend of Boston Marathon Bomber, a Burden of Shame and Betrayal
results.abstract: Ten years after the attack that killed three people and injured hundreds, Youssef Eddafali still wrestles with guilt and anger over the “monster” he thought he knew.

media.caption: Youssef Eddafali said that after the bombing 10 years ago, his trust in other people was shattered and that he could not trust himself “for allowing a sociopath to get so close.”
media.copyright: Fabeha Monir for The New York Times

media.caption: Khazar Momeni, left, and her husband, Dino Elyassnia, second from left, before a court appearance in San Francisco of Nima Momeni, her brother (not pictured), who has been charged with murder in the death of the tech entrepreneur Bob Lee.
